title: Consumers See Promise in Generative AI for Affordable Healthcare, Says Deloitte Survey
originSummary: 53% of consumers believe that Generative AI could enhance access to healthcare.
46% of consumers believe that Generative AI has the potential to make healthcare more affordable.
69% of consumers find the information received from Generative AI to be reliable, with 48% actively using the technology for health purposes.
Consumers are comfortable with clinicians using Generative AI for additional information but are less comfortable with providers using it for care decisions.
4 in 5 consumers believe it is important for healthcare providers to disclose when they are using Generative AI.
The survey suggests that consumers see Generative AI as a potential solution to healthcare challenges, improving affordability and accessibility of healthcare services.

title: Unity Introduces Muse: AI Tools for Developers to Create Assets with Ease and Ethics
originSummary: Unity has introduced Muse, a new suite of AI-powered tools designed to assist developers in generating assets such as textures and sprites.
The Muse tools aim to support smaller developers who may have limited resources and time to create assets manually.
Unity emphasizes responsible and ethical AI use to ensure that the generated assets are created without infringing on copyrighted material. The pricing for Muse is set at $30 per month.

title: Generative AI passes Legal Ethics Exam, outperforming humans
originSummary: OpenAI's GPT-4 and Anthropic's Claude 2, both generative AI models, successfully passed a Multistate Professional Responsibility Examination (MPRE) simulation, which evaluates lawyers' understanding of professional conduct rules.
GPT-4 achieved an impressive 74% accuracy rate, surpassing the average human test-taker.

The researchers believe this breakthrough indicates the potential for AI to contribute to ethical decision-making in the legal field, though the AI models' performance varied across different subject areas. This achievement marks a significant milestone in the integration of technology in the practice of law.

title: Early Lawsuits Shed Light on Privacy Concerns with Generative AI
originSummary: The rise in generative AI technology has sparked legal professionals' concerns about privacy and data security.
Companies providing AI tools are facing class action lawsuits, with allegations of privacy violations.
A survey revealed that 97% of attorneys expressed varying levels of worry about data privacy in connection to generative AI.

title: Boosting CX Efficiency in Contact Centers with Generative AI: The Ultimate Checklist
originSummary: The article explores the application of generative AI in contact centers to enhance customer experience efficiency.
It provides a three-step checklist: defining goals, assessing data availability, and focusing on customers' needs.
Setting clear objectives, utilizing reliable data, and personalizing responses are essential for improving customer satisfaction.

title: Salesforce enhances customer service with generative AI
originSummary: Salesforce has introduced a new AI capability called Service Intelligence to its Service Cloud platform.
Service Intelligence equips service agents and managers with comprehensive information to enhance customer service.
The customizable dashboards present crucial metrics such as customer satisfaction and workloads, aiding managers in making quick and informed decisions.

title: Google Introduces AI-Powered Shopping Features for the Holidays
originSummary: Google has launched new AI-powered features to help online shoppers this holiday season.
These features include AI-generated gift ideas based on user queries and the ability to find similar products and create photorealistic variations of desired items.
The virtual try-on feature has also been extended to include men's tops.
These features are currently available in the US through Google's Search Labs, with the gift idea tool already accessible and the other features rolling out soon.
Google plans to expand these features to more markets in the future to enhance the shopping experience.

title: Employees Using AI without Authorization, Survey Reveals
originSummary: A survey by Salesforce highlights that employees are utilizing generative AI for work without proper approval or authorization from their employers.
This lack of clear policies and training on generative AI poses security risks and potential infringement of intellectual property rights for businesses.

The survey also reveals that many employees are claiming AI-generated work as their own and considering exaggerating their generative AI skills for job opportunities. This emphasizes the importance of enterprises defining policies and providing training to prevent unauthorized use and promote safe and ethical usage of generative AI.
